a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: People affected by disasters vs. GDP per capita, 2021
The total number of people affected is the sum of injured, requiring assistance and homeless. Measured as the
rate per 100,000 people. GDP figures are adjusted for cross-country price differences.
People affected by disasters (affected per 100,000 people)
Data source: EM-DAT, CRED / UCLouvain (2024); Population based on various sources (2023); World Bank (2023)
Note: Deaths from extreme temperatures are not included since very few countries provide these figures; heatwave deaths are predominantly
estimated for Europe, with poor coverage of Africa, Asia or South America.
